author: Tom Olver
title: Liverpool join transfer race for ex-Manchester United defender Michael Keane
text:
Michael Keane is on Liverpool’s radar (Picture: Getty) Liverpool are reportedly in the running to sign Burnley centre-back Michael Keane in the summer.
Wenger 'furious' with Ozil and ready to sell him after latest slap in the face Keane, 24, has made 102 appearances for Burnley since leaving Manchester United back in 2015 and has earned a reputation as one of the best English defenders in the Premier League.
The Daily Mail suggest Jurgen Klopp is looking to bring a central defender to Anfield at the end of the campaign and the Clarets star is among those being considered.
It’s understood Chelsea, Everton, Manchester City and Leicester are also monitoring Keane ahead of the summer transfer window.
Jurgen Klopp as an avid admirer of Michael Keane (Picture: Getty) The former England Under-21 international only made two first-team appearances for United before leaving Old Trafford in search of regular game-time.

RB Leipzig forward Timo Werner is also believed to be one of Liverpool’s top targets off the back of the 21-year-old’s barnstorming season in the Bundesliga.
The Merseyside outfit are believed to have held talks with Leipzig over the possibility of signing the youngster.
